all_attributes.desc: Indicates if an asset was already depreciated before registering it in Exact Online

all_attributes.desc: Assets can be linked to a cost center

all_attributes.name: Costunit
all_attributes.desc: Assets can be linked to a cost unit

all_attributes.desc: Used for Belgium legislation. Used to produce the official 'Investment deduction' report

all_attributes.desc: Amount that is already depreciated when adding an existing asset. Can only be filled when 'Alreadydepreciated' is on

all_attributes.desc: Number of periods that already have been depreciated for the asset. Can only be filled when 'Alreadydepreciated' is on

all_attributes.name: DepreciatedStartDate
all_attributes.desc: StartDate of depreciating. Can only be filled when 'Alreadydepreciated' is on

all_attributes.name: Description
all_attributes.desc: This is the description of the Asset

all_attributes.desc: Asset EndDate is filled when asset is Sold or Inactive

all_attributes.name: EngineEmission
all_attributes.desc: Engine emission of the asset, needed to calculate the coÂ² report

all_attributes.name: EngineType
all_attributes.desc: Engine type of the asset, Needed to generate a coÂ² report

all_attributes.name: GLTransactionLine
all_attributes.desc: Links to the gltransactions.id. GL transaction line based on which the asset is created

all_attributes.name: InvestmentAmountDC
all_attributes.desc: Investment amount in the default currency of the company

all_attributes.name: InvestmentAmountFC
all_attributes.desc: Investment value of the asset. Currently the field is filled with the PurchasePriceLocal. Can be status 'Not used' after sources have been cleaned

all_attributes.name: InvestmentCurrency
all_attributes.desc: Indicates the currency of the investment amount

all_attributes.name: InvestmentDate
all_attributes.desc: Refers to the original date when the asset was bought

all_attributes.name: InvestmentDeduction
all_attributes.desc: Belgian functionality, to determine how a local legal report regarding investment deduction must be created

all_attributes.name: PrimaryMethod
all_attributes.desc: First method of depreciation. Currently, it is the only one used

all_attributes.name: ResidualValue
all_attributes.desc: Indicates the residual value of the asset at the end of the depreciation

all_attributes.name: Status
all_attributes.desc: Identifies the status of the Asset. (see AssetStatus table to see the possibilities)

all_attributes.name: Amount
all_attributes.desc: When the method is fixed amount, this is the periodic depreciation amount

all_attributes.name: MaxPercentage
all_attributes.desc: Indicates the maximum value when using depreciation type degressive to linear

all_attributes.name: Percentage
all_attributes.desc: Degressive percentage for methods: 10 - Degressive to linear, 11 - Degressive (fixed perc. of book value), 12 - Degressive to linear (Belgium & Luxembourg only). And interest percentage for method: 40 - Normal annuity method. On import: Can not be modified if depreciation method is already linked to an asset. For Belgium & Luxembourg the degressive percentage is calculated as double of the linear percentage

all_attributes.name: Percentage2
all_attributes.desc: Linear percentage for methods: 10 - Degressive to linear, 3 - Linear depreciation (Belgium & Luxembourg only), 12 - Degressive to linear (Belgium & Luxembourg only). On import: Can not be modified if depreciation method is already linked to an asset

all_attributes.name: Periods
all_attributes.desc: The total number of periods for the depreciation method. Used in combination with depreciation interval: only used when interval is periodic

all_attributes.name: Type
all_attributes.desc: The actual type of deprecation, such as lineair or degressive. The periodic amounts are based on this type, in combination with other fields, such as the interval and the periods

all_attributes.name: Years
all_attributes.desc: Determines the total number of years for the depreciation method. Used in combination with depreciation interval: only used when interval is yearly

all_attributes.name: AmountDC
all_attributes.desc: Budget amount (always in the default currency of the company)

all_attributes.desc: Used for cost center-specific budgets - NULL otherwise

all_attributes.name: Costunit
all_attributes.desc: Used for cost unit-specific budgets - NULL otherwise

all_attributes.name: HID
all_attributes.desc: Numerical ID. Never displayed to the user, but it may have its use for performance reasons

all_attributes.name: Item
all_attributes.desc: Used for item-specific budgets - NULL otherwise

all_attributes.desc: Maximum amount of credit for sales. If no value has been defined, there is no credit limit

all_attributes.name: DiscountSales
all_attributes.desc: Default discount percentage for sales. This is stored as a fraction. ie 5.5% is stored as .055

all_attributes.name: EndDate
all_attributes.desc: Determines in combination with the start date if the account is active. If the current date is > end date the account is inactive

all_attributes.desc: Default (corporate) GL offset account for purchase (cost)

all_attributes.name: GLAccountSales

all_attributes.name: GLAR

all_attributes.name: IsAgency

all_attributes.name: IsCompetitor

all_attributes.name: SalesVATCode

The VAT type determines what the values are in relation to VAT returns. The following values are supported:
A Sales VAT to pay,
I Purchase basis,
M Credit note purchase non-deductible,
N Purchase non-deductible,
O Purchase VAT to claim,
P Purchase VAT to pay,
Q Credit note purchase VAT to claim,
R Extra duty to pay,
S No VAT,
V Sales basis,
W Credit note purchase basis,
X Credit note sales basis,
Y Credit note purchase VAT to pay,
Z Credit note sales VAT to claim

all_attributes.desc: Indicates the purchase discount GL account linked to the VAT codes for German legislation

all_attributes.name: GLDiscountSales
all_attributes.desc: Indicates the sales discount GL account linked to the VAT codes for German legislation

all_attributes.name: GLToClaim
all_attributes.desc: G/L account that is used to book the VAT to claim. If you enter purchases with a VAT code, the VAT amount to be claimed is entered to this VAT account. Must be of type VAT

all_attributes.name: GLToPay
all_attributes.desc: G/L account that is used to book the VAT to pay. If you enter sales with a VAT code, the VAT amount to be paid is entered to this VAT account. Must be of type VAT

all_attributes.name: IsBlocked
all_attributes.desc: Indicates if the VAT code may still be used

all_attributes.name: LegalText
all_attributes.desc: Legal description for VAT code to print in the total block of the invoice

all_attributes.name: TaxReturnType
all_attributes.desc: Indicates what type of Taxcode it is: can be VAT, IncomeTax

all_attributes.name: Type
all_attributes.desc: Indicates how the VAT amount should be calculated in relation to the invoice amount. B = VAT 0% (Only base amount), E = Excluding, I = Including, N = No VAT

all_attributes.name: VatDocType
all_attributes.desc: Field in VAT code maintenance to calculate different VATs depending on the selected document type. P = purchase invoice, F = freelance invoice, E = expense voucher. The field is valid for witholding tax type

all_attributes.name: VatMargin
all_attributes.desc: The VAT margin scheme is used for the trade of secondhand goods which are purchased without VAT (for example when a company buys a secondhand good from a private person). In the VAT margin scheme, the VAT is not calculated based on the sales price. Instead of that, the VAT is calculated based on the margin (gross sales price minus the gross purchase price)

all_attributes.name: VATPartialRatio
all_attributes.desc: Partial ratio explains which part of the VAT the company has to pay. Used in some branches where the sellers have a bad reputation, so the buyers have to take over the VAT-liability

all_attributes.name: VATPercentages
all_attributes.desc: VAT percentages. You can have several VAT percentages, with start and end dates

all_attributes.name: VATTransactionType
all_attributes.desc: Indicates the type of transactions for which the VAT code may be used. B = Both, P = Purchase, S = Sales

all_attributes.name: EndDate
all_attributes.desc: End date of the date range during which this percentage is valid

all_attributes.name: StartDate
all_attributes.desc: Start date of the date range during which this percentage is valid

all_attributes.name: DownloadUrl
all_attributes.desc: The binary is accessed through this url

all_attributes.name: Request
all_attributes.desc: The request this attachment is linked to
